snippet: As Fox News’s own polling showed an advantage for Mr. Obama late in the campaign, commentators on the network questioned whether the news organization had its numbers right.
abstract: Fox News commentators, most notably Karl Rove, question the results of the network's own pollsters on Election Night as results streamed in showing a steady advantage for Pres Obama; network anchor, in one particularly awkward instance, goes behind the set in order to interrogate the show's vote analysts.

byline.original: By JEREMY W. PETERS and BRIAN STELTER

lead_paragraph: As Fox News’s own polling showed an advantage for Mr. Obama late in the campaign, commentators on the network questioned whether the news organization had its numbers right.

headline.main: On Fox News, a Mistrust of Pro-Obama Numbers Lasts Late Into the Night
headline.print_headline: On Fox News, a Mistrust Of Pro-Obama Numbers Lasts Late Into the Night
